title: Strategy
text: Represent GWAS summary data multiple sources various different shapes different tools Represent class structure packages can call dependencies Ensure harmonisation data across different sources able simulate data ease analytical prototyping Store relevant meta data methods visualising, joining subsetting datasets Create examples analytical tools creating methods import gwasglue2 package. example ‘structures’ summary datasets able handle

title: Strategy
text: Data structures Note whole OpenGWAS database example ‘complete’ dataset - traits variants. typically want represent gwasglue2 specific slice data, almost always going rectangular shape - set variants across set traits. addition, need able able flexibly associate metadata forms annotations (LD matrices, genomic annotations etc) data. Finally, analytical tools need aware structures order easily deploy methods upon .

title: Strategy
text: typically workflow might look: Work flow able ingest data various locations, class provides number different ways manipulate annotate data.

title: Strategy
text: set genetic associations (1 ) single trait known SummarySet. class contain data, plus MetaData describes source study, plus list Concepts annotate Summary data. Concept named list extra information can linked data, example LD matrices, annotations relating use data model (e.g. exposure outcome), etc. Dataset set merged harmonised SummarySets, example two SummarySets generated using set variants two traits, putting together Dataset find intersect available variants, harmonise effect allele. Dataset objects can also global Concept list extra data common across SummarySets stored object. Initial visualisation : Class structures

title: Strategy
text: Currently planning implement S4 class, may move R7 future stable compatible roxygen etc.

title: Strategy
text: Association data within SummarySet following fields - chromosome position effect allele (ALT) non-effect allele (REF) effect size standard error p-value effect allele frequency rsid imputation info score sample size number cases number controls Metadata fields - genome build units effect size number cases number controls trait name trait identifier ancestral population sample sex sample study DOI number variants Ontology term standard deviation trait mean trait genotyping method analysis method covariates notes Accession info generated upon creation: Data source Timestamp access Query

title: Tutorial
text: perform MR analysis body mass index (exposure - ieu--2) coronary heart disease (outcome - ieu--7). Obtain data Set Metadata MR labels summary sets Check Metadata MR labels Create DataSet object Convert dataset TwoSampleMR format Perform MR analysis
code: x <- clumpTophits(traits = "ieu-a-2") sumset1 <- SummarySet(traits = "ieu-a-2", variants = x, tools = "mr") sumset1 sumset2 <- SummarySet(traits="ieu-a-7", variants=x,tools ="mr") sumset2 sumset1 <- setMetadata(sumset1, source = "IEUopenGWAS", traits = "ieu-a-2") sumset1 <-setMRlabel(sumset1, mr_label = "exposure")  sumset2 <- setMetadata(sumset2,source = "IEUopenGWAS", traits = "ieu-a-7") sumset2 <-setMRlabel(sumset2, mr_label = "outcome") getMetadata(sumset1) getMRlabel(sumset1)  getMetadata(sumset2) getMRlabel(sumset2) dataset <- DataSet(sumset1,sumset2) %>%   overlapSNP(.) %>%   harmoniseData(.,tolerance = 0.08,action = 2) dataset_mr <- convertForTwoSampleMR(dataset) mr_result <-  merge(dataset_mr@summary_sets[[1]]@ss,dataset_mr@summary_sets[[2]]@ss, by = c("SNP", "mr_keep"))  %>%   TwoSampleMR::mr(., method_list="mr_ivw")  mr_result

title: Tutorial
text: need first define genomic range analysis performed. known LD block chromosome 22 (build hg19) need scan OpenGWAS traits significant associations region Obtain data Next, trait need perform finemapping. involve using SusieR identify credible sets region trait, generate conditional summary datasets credible set. Explanation: Credible set: trait inferred e.g. 3 causal variants genomic region 3 credible sets. credible set essentially cluster SNPs close , include 1 SNPs candidates causal variant. Conditional summary datasets: credible sets identified, can try estimate summary data results looked like credible set accounting credible sets. example 3 conditional summary datasets, single peak different location. Use susieR generate credible sets dataset (e.g. 1, 1. least 1 selected association region) Finally, can perform colocalisation. want jointly colocalise across conditional summary datasets
code: genomicrange <- "22:43714200-44995307" id_list <- ieugwasr::phewas(pval = 5e-6, variants=genomicrange, batch="ukb-a")$id %>%   unique() dataset <- gwasglue2::create_dataset(traits=id_list, variants=genomicrange) %>%   gwasglue2::annotate(ld_matrix="1000genomes_EUR") dataset <- gwasglue2::annotate(dataset = ., credible_sets="susieR") result <- dataset %>%   hyprcoloc::hyprcoloc(dataset=.)

title: Tutorial
text: ’ll analyse following IDs (chd - cardiac heart disease; ldl - low-density lipoprotein; hdl - high-density lipoprotein; trig - triglycerides t2d - type 2 diabetes) around HMGCR (3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl-CoA reductase) gene region. Create summarysets Create dataset harmonise trait trait, trait LD matrix summary sets harmonised, marginalise summary set independently create new dataset marginalised summary sets merged datasets marginalised, going merge just ones Try hyprcoloc raw datasets. (Use fork hypercoloc allows dataset object provided) Try hyprcoloc marginalised datasets Also try regions: PCSK9 (proprotein convertase subtilisin/kexin type 9) gene region Create dataset harmonise trait trait, trait LD matrix (note saving SummarySet objects separately, filling directly DataSet). Marginalise summary set independently create new dataset marginalised summary sets merged datasets marginalised, going merge just ones Try hyprcoloc raw datasets. Try hyprcoloc marginalised datasets NPC1L1 (NPC1 like intracellular cholesterol transporter 1) gene region Create dataset harmonise trait trait, trait LD matrix Marginalise summary set independently create new dataset marginalised summary sets merged datasets marginalised, going merge just ones Try hyprcoloc raw datasets. Try hyprcoloc marginalised datasets LPA (Lipoprotein()) gene region Create dataset harmonise trait trait, trait LD matrix Marginalise summary set independently create new dataset marginalised summary sets merged datasets marginalised, going merge just ones Try hyprcoloc raw datasets. Try hyprcoloc marginalised datasets
code: library(gwasglue2)  remotes::install_github('ritarasteiro/hyprcoloc', build_opts = c('--resave-data', '--no-manual'), build_vignettes = FALSE, dependencies = TRUE)  remotes::install_github('ritarasteiro/susieR')  library(susieR)     # fork that takes Summaryset library(hyprcoloc)  # fork that takes Dataset chd_id <- "ieu-a-7" ldl_id <- "ieu-b-110" hdl_id <- "ieu-b-109" trig_id <- "ieu-b-111" t2d_id <- "ebi-a-GCST006867" hmgcr_chrpos <- "5:74132993-75132993" ids <- c(chd_id, ldl_id, hdl_id, trig_id, t2d_id) # create s4 SummarySet objects (named sumset1...n) and fill metadata slot using the createSummarySets() in ieugwas_utils  for (i in seq_along(ids)){   s <- createSummarySets(traits=ids[i],                           variants = "5:74132993-75132993",                           tools = c("finemap","coloc"),                           source = "IEUopenGWAS",                           ld_ref = "/project/data/reference/ld/EUR")                           assign(paste0("sumset",i) , s)  } # create S4 DataSet object (hmgcr) ds_hmgcr <- DataSet(sumset1,sumset2,sumset3,sumset4,sumset5) %>%   overlapSNP(.) %>%   harmoniseData(.,tolerance = 0.08,action = 1) %>%   buildLDMatrix(., bfile = TRUE, plink_bin = "plink") %>%   harmoniseLDMatrix(.) # do finemapping with susie ntraits <- getLength(ds_hmgcr) ds_hmgcr_marginalised <- lapply(1:ntraits, function(trait)   {     # Takes in 1 SS     # Outputs 1 DS (with at least 1 SS)     ds <- susie_rss(R = getLDMatrix(ds_hmgcr,trait), summaryset = getSummarySet(ds_hmgcr, trait)) })   susieR is using gwasglue2 SummarySet class object as input WARNING: There is no credible sets for this trait (ieu-a-7), with the parameter values used. The summary statistics beta and se will not be marginalised. susieR is using gwasglue2 SummarySet class object as input susieR is using gwasglue2 SummarySet class object as input susieR is using gwasglue2 SummarySet class object as input WARNING: There is no credible sets for this trait (ieu-b-111), with the parameter values used. The summary statistics beta and se will not be marginalised. susieR is using gwasglue2 SummarySet class object as input WARNING: There is no credible sets for this trait (ebi-a-GCST006867), with the parameter values used. The summary statistics beta and se will not be marginalised. ds_hmgcr_marginalised <- merge_datasets(ds_hmgcr_marginalised[[2]], ds_hmgcr_marginalised[[3]]) res_hmgcr <- hyprcoloc(dataset = ds_hmgcr) hyprcoloc is using gwasglue2 DataSet class object as input  print(res_hmgcr)  $results   iteration                      traits posterior_prob regional_prob 1         1          ieu-a-7, ieu-b-110         0.5940        0.6052 2         2 ieu-b-109, ebi-a-GCST006867         0.9934        0.9997   candidate_snp posterior_explained_by_snp dropped_trait 1       rs12916                     0.9996            NA 2     rs2307111                     0.9932            NA  attr(,"class") [1] "hyprcoloc" res_hmgcr_marginalised <- hyprcoloc(dataset = ds_hmgcr_marginalised) hyprcoloc is using gwasglue2 DataSet class object as input  print(res_hmgcr_marginalised) $results   iteration                     traits posterior_prob regional_prob 1         1 ieu-b-110_L2, ieu-b-110_L3         0.7226        1.0000 2         2 ieu-b-110_L1, ieu-b-110_L4         0.3766        0.5999   candidate_snp posterior_explained_by_snp dropped_trait 1    rs59992948                     0.0106            NA 2    rs16872674                     0.0087            NA  attr(,"class") [1] "hyprcoloc" pcsk9_chrpos <- "1:55005221-56005221" npc1l1_chrpos <- "7:44052134-45052134" lpa_chrpos <- "6:155952514-165952514" # create S4 DataSet object (pcsk9) pcsk9_chrpos <- "1:55005221-56005221" pcsk9 <- DataSet() for (i in seq_along(ids)){   s <- createSummarySets(traits=ids[i],                           variants = "1:55005221-56005221",                           tools = c("finemap","coloc"),                           source = "IEUopenGWAS",                           ld_ref = "/project/data/reference/ld/EUR")                          pcsk9@summary_sets[[i]] <- s }  pcsk9 <-  pcsk9 %>%   overlapSNP(.) %>%   harmoniseData(.,tolerance = 0.08,action = 1) %>%   buildLDMatrix(., bfile = TRUE, plink_bin = "plink") %>%   harmoniseLDMatrix(.) # do finemapping with susie ntraits <- getLength(pcsk9) pcsk9_marginalised <- lapply(1:ntraits, function(trait)   {     # Takes in 1 SS     # Outputs 1 DS (with at least 1 SS)     ds <- susie_rss(R = getLDMatrix(pcsk9,trait), summaryset = getSummarySet(pcsk9, trait)) })   susieR is using gwasglue2 SummarySet class object as input WARNING: There is no credible sets for this trait (ieu-a-7), with the parameter values used. The summary statistics beta and se will not be marginalised. susieR is using gwasglue2 SummarySet class object as input susieR is using gwasglue2 SummarySet class object as input WARNING: There is no credible sets for this trait (ieu-b-109), with the parameter values used. The summary statistics beta and se will not be marginalised. susieR is using gwasglue2 SummarySet class object as input WARNING: There is no credible sets for this trait (ieu-b-111), with the parameter values used. The summary statistics beta and se will not be marginalised. susieR is using gwasglue2 SummarySet class object as input WARNING: There is no credible sets for this trait (ebi-a-GCST006867), with the parameter values used. The summary statistics beta and se will not be marginalised. ds_hmgcr_marginalised <- merge_datasets(ds_hmgcr_marginalised[[2]]) res_pcsk9 <- hyprcoloc(dataset = pcsk9) hyprcoloc is using gwasglue2 DataSet class object as input print(res_pcsk9) $results   iteration traits posterior_prob regional_prob candidate_snp 1         1   None             NA        0.1472            NA 2         2   None dropped_trait 1                         NA        ieu-b-110 2                         NA          ieu-a-7 3                         NA ebi-a-GCST006867 4                         NA        ieu-b-109  attr(,"class") [1] "hyprcoloc" res_pcsk9_marginalised <- hyprcoloc(dataset =pcsk9_marginalised) hyprcoloc is using gwasglue2 DataSet class object as input  print(res_pcsk9_marginalised) $results   iteration traits posterior_prob regional_prob candidate_snp 1         1   None             NA        0.6947            NA 2         2   None             NA        0.4759            NA 3         3   None             NA        0.3103            NA 4         4   None             NA        0.0017            NA 5         5   None             NA        0.0010            NA 6         6   None             NA        0.0001            NA 7         7   None             NA        0.0003            NA 8         8   None             NA        0.0001            NA 9         9   None             NA        0.0001            NA   posterior_explained_by_snp dropped_trait 1                         NA  ieu-b-110_L6 2                         NA  ieu-b-110_L1 3                         NA  ieu-b-110_L5 4                         NA  ieu-b-110_L2 5                         NA  ieu-b-110_L7 6                         NA  ieu-b-110_L4 7                         NA  ieu-b-110_L8 8                         NA  ieu-b-110_L3 9                         NA  ieu-b-110_L9  attr(,"class") [1] "hyprcoloc" # create S4 DataSet object (npc1l1) npc1l1_chrpos <- "7:44052134-45052134" npc1l1 <- DataSet() for (i in seq_along(ids)){   s <- createSummarySets(traits=ids[i],                           variants = "7:44052134-45052134",                           tools = c("finemap","coloc"),                           source = "IEUopenGWAS",                           ld_ref = "/project/data/reference/ld/EUR")                          npc1l1@summary_sets[[i]] <- s }  npc1l1 <-  npc1l1 %>%   overlapSNP(.) %>%   harmoniseData(.,tolerance = 0.08,action = 1) %>%   buildLDMatrix(., bfile = TRUE, plink_bin = "plink") %>%   harmoniseLDMatrix(.) ntraits <- getLength( npc1l1) npc1l1_marginalised <- lapply(1:ntraits, function(trait)   {     # Takes in 1 SS     # Outputs 1 DS (with at least 1 SS)     ds <- susie_rss(R = getLDMatrix(npc1l1,trait), summaryset = getSummarySet( npc1l1, trait)) })  susieR is using gwasglue2 SummarySet class object as input WARNING: There is no credible sets for this trait (ieu-a-7), with the parameter values used. The summary statistics beta and se will not be marginalised. susieR is using gwasglue2 SummarySet class object as input susieR is using gwasglue2 SummarySet class object as input susieR is using gwasglue2 SummarySet class object as input susieR is using gwasglue2 SummarySet class object as input npc1l1_marginalised <- merge_datasets(npc1l1_marginalised[[2]],npc1l1_marginalised[[3]],npc1l1_marginalised[[4]],npc1l1_marginalised[[5]]) res_npc1l1 <- hyprcoloc(dataset = npc1l1) hyprcoloc is using gwasglue2 DataSet class object as input  print(res_npc1l1) $results   iteration traits posterior_prob regional_prob candidate_snp 1         1   None             NA        0.0348            NA 2         2   None posterior_prob regional_prob candidate_snp 1         1   None             NA        0.0402            NA 2         2   None             NA        0.0577            NA 3         3   None             NA S4 DataSet object (lpa) lpa_chrpos <- "6:155952514-165952514" lpa <- DataSet() for (i in seq_along(ids)){   s <- createSummarySets(traits=ids[i],                           variants = "6:155952514-165952514",                           tools = c("finemap","coloc"),                           source = "IEUopenGWAS",                           ld_ref = "/project/data/reference/ld/EUR")                          lpa@summary_sets[[i]] <- s }  lpa <-  lpa %>%   overlapSNP(.) %>%   harmoniseData(.,tolerance = 0.08,action = 1) %>%   buildLDMatrix(., bfile = TRUE, plink_bin = "plink") %>%   harmoniseLDMatrix(.) ntraits <- getLength(lpa) npc1l1_marginalised <- lapply(1:ntraits, function(trait)   {     # Takes in 1 SS     # Outputs 1 DS (with at least 1 SS)     ds <- susie_rss(R = getLDMatrix(lpa,trait), summaryset = getSummarySet(lpa, trait)) })   lpa_marginalised <- merge_datasets() res_lpa <- hyprcoloc(dataset = nlpa) print(res_lpa) res_lpa_marginalised <- hyprcoloc(dataset =lpa_marginalised) print(res_lpa_marginalised)

what: GWAS summary data sources connected to analytical tools
title: GWAS summary data sources connected to analytical tools
text: package part OpenGWAS project. aims reduce friction connecting GWAS summary data sources range analytical tools. See Strategy vignette information. aims replace original gwasglue package still early development.

title: GWAS summary data sources connected to analytical tools
text: can install development version gwasglue2 GitHub :

what: An S4 class to represent the Data Set — DataSet-class
title: An S4 class to represent the Data Set — DataSet-class
text: S4 class represent Data Set

title: An S4 class to represent the Data Set — DataSet-class
text: summary_sets list SummarySet objects (default NA). overlap_SNPs among SummarySets is_resized logical (default FALSE). is_harmonised logical (default FALSE). overall_dropped_SNPs vector RSIDs removed summary_sets. dropped_SNPs list pairwise harmonising ouptput (SNPs removed summary_sets ) palindromic_SNPs list pairwise harmonising ouptput. ambiguous_SNPs list pairwise harmonising ouptput. incompatible_alleles_SNPs list pairwise harmonising ouptput. ld_matrices list LD correlation matrices (default NA). is_harmonisedLD logical (default FALSE). zscores vector calculated z-scores susieR susieR::susie_rss() output is_converted logical (default FALSE).

EUR) used build LD correlation matrix (default NA). pop population code ieugwasr (eg. EUR) used build LD correlation matrix (default NA).

title:
Harmonise the alleles and effects between two summary sets
This is based o the harmonise function of TwoSampleMR — harmonise
code: harmonise(rsid, A1, A2, B1, B2, betaA, betaB, fA, fB, tolerance, action)

title:
Harmonise the alleles and effects between two summary sets
This is based o the harmonise function of TwoSampleMR — harmonise
text: action Level strictness dealing SNPs. action = 1: Assume alleles coded forward strand, .e. attempt flip alleles action = 2: Try infer positive strand alleles, using allele frequencies palindromes (default, conservative); action = 3: Correct strand non-palindromic SNPs, drop palindromic SNPs analysis (conservative).

what: Harmonise the alleles and effects between two summary sets — harmoniseData
title: Harmonise the alleles and effects between two summary sets — harmoniseData
text: Harmonise alleles effects two summary sets

title: Harmonise the alleles and effects between two summary sets — harmoniseData
Harmonise the alleles and effects between two summary sets — harmoniseData
text: object DataSet object tolerance Tolerance value (default 0.08). action Level strictness dealing SNPs. action = 1: Assume alleles coded forward strand, .e. attempt flip alleles action = 2: Try infer positive strand alleles, using allele frequencies palindromes (default, conservative); action = 3: Correct strand non-palindromic SNPs, drop palindromic SNPs analysis (conservative).

text: dat1 Output mv_extract_dat1s. dat2 Output extract_dat2a(dat1$rsid, id_output). harmonise_strictness See action option harmonise_data. default 2.

title: Harmonise dat1 and dat2 for multivariable MR — mv_harmonise_data
text: List vectors matrices required mv analysis. dat1_beta matrix beta coefficients, rows correspond SNPs columns correspond dat1s. dat1_se dat1_beta, standard errors. dat1_pval dat1_beta, p-values. expname data frame two variables, id.dat1 dat1 character strings. dat2_beta array effects dat2, corresponding SNPs dat1_beta. dat2_se array standard errors dat2. dat2_pval array p-values dat2. outname data frame two variables, id.dat2 dat2 character strings.
